Are there really no way of listing all the pages in a CMS in a module?
Or even relate pages to each other?

I know I can query the API from an external service and upload a json file that can be read, but that is like a 1998 solution.
Been roaming the Internetz to find a solution, but I really was hoping there was a {{system.pages}} value of some sort ..

For what I know not. I was hoping that when they introduced the sitemap feature it would be possible to query all childpages for a parent page. This would be such an easy, elegant and powerfull feature bringing value to lot's of clients. Unfortunately it is not possible today... We stick to abusing the blog for any type of relational pages
Would be happy to know how people in the community work their way around this limitation.

Most folks typically use CRM object dynamic pages or HubDB dynamic pages for creating relationships between the pages and generating listings, filters, categorization etc.

<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/data/dynamic-pages>

there’s basically 3 ways folks create taxonomy (to use the wordpress term) like functionality in HubSpot. CRM objects - purpose built for this basically. HubDB, also well suited for this, but best used for situations where you don’t need to relate the records to your CRM objects. Blog - an old-fashioned approach folks used to do before HubDB and CRM objects existed, still works, but is less ideal than the other methods.

Thanks for your input Jon! When using CRM object you lose all the flexibility of the page builder i'm afraid? I definitely see how crm object can be a solution for more structured content (jobs, events, ...) but for more flexible content pages using a CRM object is leas suitable? Or am I seeing things wrong here?

%} ? i want to be able to use flexbox in my column.
I haven't tested it recently, but I think you can only add `class="class_name"` to `{% dnd_section %}`, then you could use child CSS selectors to target the column
good idea, it serves me a lot. Thank you <@U03KAK3R4GY> :tada:

Having flexible alternate layouts and different sets of modules yes is a little more complicated with dynamic pages since they work like off of a single template, but there are things you can do to code in differences between pages.

That said yes you lose the drag and dropability in individual record pages. Though you can have drag and drop for both the listing and the record page - it’s just that the record page dnd edits for all of the record pages not just each one individually.
